question.question_html: Which of the following is not correctly matched?

answers.text_html: Inquiry Section 2(g)
Judicial proceedings Section 2(i)
Police Station - Section 2(q)
Pleader -Section 2(q)

question.subject: Uncategorized
question.explanation_html:
Explanation: Police Station- Section 2(q), Section 2 (s) of CrPC defines the term "Police Station" as any post or place declared generally or specially by the State Government, to be a police station, and includes any local area specified by the State Government in this behalf.

Q4.) Explanation: Ans. (d) Magistrate or court. As per Section 2 (g) of CrPC, inquiry means every inquiry, other than a trial, conducted under this Code by a Magistrate or Court.

question.question_html: Classification of compoundable and non-compoundable offences' has been provided under

answers.text_html: 1st Schedule of Cr. P.C)
2nd Schedule of Cr. P.C)
Section 320 of Cr.P.C)
Section 321 of Cr. P.C)

question.subject: Uncategorized
question.explanation_html: Section 320 of Cr. P.C. Section 320 of the Code of CrPC deals with the classification of "compoundable and non-compoundable offences.

question.question_html: Section 25A was inserted in Cr. P.C) by which of the following Amendment Act?

answers.text_html: Cr. P.C)Amendment Act, 2008
Cr.P.C) Amendment Act, 2005
Cr. P.C) Amendment Act, 2009
Cr. P.C) Amendment Act, 1978

question.subject: Uncategorized
question.explanation_html: Cr. P.C. Amendment Act, 2005. Section 25A of CrPC deals with Directorate of Prosecution which has been s inserted in CrPC by Criminal Amendment Act, 2005.

question.question_html: Inquiry is conducted by

answers.text_html: Magistrate only
Police officer only
Session Court only
Magistrate or court

question.subject: Uncategorized
question.explanation_html: As per Section 2 (g) of CrPC, inquiry means every inquiry, other than a trial, conducted under this Code by a Magistrate or Court.

question.question_html: Which one of the following sections of the Cr. P.C) provides that a person once convicted or acquitted shall not be tried again for the same offence ?

answers.text_html: Section 303
Section 20(3)
Section 300(1)
None of the above

question.subject: Uncategorized
question.explanation_html: Explanation: Ans. (c) Section 300(1) Section 300 deals with person once convicted or acquitted not to be tried for same offence

question.question_html: Who among the following may withdraw prosecution of any person at any time before the judgement is pronounced?

answers.text_html: The State Government
The Public Prosecutor
The aggrieved person
The Writer of F.I.R.

question.subject: Uncategorized
question.explanation_html: Explanation: Ans. (b) The Public Prosecutor. Section 321 of CrPC states that the Public Prosecutor or Assistant Public Prosecutor in charge of a case may, with the consent of the Court at any time before the judgment is pronounced, withdraw from the prosecution of any person either generally or in respect of any one or more of the offences for which he is tried.

question.question_html: Which one of the following Sections of Cr. P.C) provides free legal aid to the accused ?

answers.text_html: S. 304
S. 306
S. 301
S. 302

question.subject: Uncategorized
question.explanation_html: Explanation: Ans. (a) S. 304 Section 304 of CrPC states that where, in a trial before the Court of Session, the accused is not represented by a pleader, and where it appears to the Court that the accused has not sufficient means to engage a pleader, the Court shall assign a pleader for his defence at the expense of the State.

question.question_html: Under Cr. P.C), which of the following is correctly matched?

answers.text_html: Procedure where judges of Court of appeal are equally divided - Section 392
Finality of judgement and orders on appeal Section 394
Reference to the High Court - Section 396
Arrest of accused in appeal from acquittal -Section 391.

question.subject: Uncategorized
question.explanation_html: Explanation: Ans.(a) Procedure where judges of Court of appeal are equally divided - Section 392 Sections 393, 395 and 390 of CrPC deal with the finality of judgment and orders on appeal; reference to the high court and arrest of accused in appeal from acquittal, respectively.

question.question_html: An accused may apply for plea-bargaining where he has committed :

answers.text_html: an offence for which the punishment extends for imprisonment exceeding seven years.
An offence which affects socio-economic condition of the country.
an offence against a woman.
an offence of theft.

question.subject: Uncategorized
question.explanation_html: Explanation: Ans. (d) an offence of theft. According to Section 265A of CrPC, plea bargaining does not apply in cases where the offence which affects socio-economic condition of the country or offence against a woman or a child below the age of 14 years or offence for which the punishment extends for death, life imprisonment or of imprisonment for a term exceeding seven years. The offence of theft is punishable with three years, therefore in such case, plea bargaining can be applied.

question.question_html: Which one of the following group of sections of Cr. P.C) deals with proclamation and attachment ?

answers.text_html: Sections 80 to 85
Sections 82 to 86
Sections 82 to 90
Sections 80 to 86

question.subject: Uncategorized
question.explanation_html: Explanation: Ans. (b) Sections 82 to 86. Sections 82 to 86 of CrPC deal with proclamation and attachment.

question.question_html: Where an offence consists of several acts done in different local areas, which section clarifies the rule applicable for this conundrum?

answers.text_html: Section 178a)
Section 178(b)
Section 178(c)
Section 178(d)

question.subject: Uncategorized
question.explanation_html: Explanation : Ans : d) Where an offence consists of several acts done in different local areas, it may be inquired into or tried by a court having jurisdiction over any of such local areas. [Sec. 178(d)]

question.question_html: Which one of the following section of Cr. P.C) provides public to give information of certain offences to the police officer?

answers.text_html: Section 38
Section 40
Section 39
All of the above

question.subject: Uncategorized
question.explanation_html: Explanation: Ans.(c) Section 39. Section 39 of CrPC enables the public to give information of certain offences to the police officer offences against the State, public tranquility or relating to public tranquility, illegal gratification etc.

question.question_html: Which one of the following Section of Cr. P.C) provides identification of arrested person?

answers.text_html: Section 54
Section 54A
Section 55A
Section 60A

question.subject: Uncategorized
question.explanation_html: Explanation: Ans. (b) Section 54A. Section 54A of CrPC provides identification of arrested person by any other person or persons, if it is necessary for the investigation.

question.question_html: Who of the following may order for maintenance of wives, children and parents under Cr. P.C) 1973?

answers.text_html: Only Executive Magistrate
Judicial Magistrate 2nd Class
Magistrate of the 1st Class
All of the above

question.subject: Uncategorized
question.explanation_html: Explanation: Ans.(c) Magistrate of the 1st Class. Magistrate of the 1st Class is empowered to deal with the proceedings relating for maintenance ofwives, children and parents under Section 125 of CrPC.

question.question_html:
A High Court under its inherent powers conferred under Section 482 of Cr. P.C) passes the following orders :

(i)It quashes the F.I.R.

(ii) It quashes proceeding of case pending before a criminal court.

(iii) It expunges the derogatory remarks against a member of subordinate court. Having in view the validity of above order choose the correct answer given below

answers.text_html: Only (i) is valid)
(i) and (ii) are both valid)
(i), (ii) and (iii) all are valid)
(i) and (iii) are valid)

question.subject: Uncategorized
question.explanation_html: Explanation: Ans. (c) (i), (ii) and (iii) all are valid. Section 482 of CrPC provides a wide and extra ordinary power given to high court in case there is no provision or for the ends of justice. All options are correct.

question.question_html: In which of the following cases it was held that a person has a right to protection under Section 161(2) of Cr.P.C) against questions,the answers of charge which? would have a tendency to a criminal

answers.text_html: Nandini Satpathy V/sP.L. Dani
Gian Singh V/s State
Rupan Deol Bajaj V/s K.P.S. Gill
R.K. Dalmia V/s Delhi Administration

question.subject: Uncategorized
question.explanation_html: Explanation: Ans.(a) Nandini Satpathy V/sP.L. Dani . In Nandini Satpathy V/s P.L. Dani, the Court held that a person has a right to protection under Section 161(2) of Cr P.C. against questions, the answers ofwhich would have a tendency to a criminal charge.

question.question_html: Under which of the following sections of the complaint . Cr.P.C) ? the Magistrate shall dismiss the

answers.text_html: Section 202
Section 201
Section 203
None of the above

question.subject: Uncategorized
question.explanation_html: Explanation: Ans.(c) Section 203. According to Section 203 of CrPC, the Magistrate can dismiss the complaint if he is of the opinion after the examination under section 200 that there are no grounds to carry on the case.

question.question_html: Under which section of Cr.P.C), court has discretionary power to summon any person as a witness?

answers.text_html: Section 311
Section 319
Section 311-A
Section 313

question.subject: Uncategorized
question.explanation_html: Explanation: Ans.(a) Section 311. Regarding section 311 CrPC, in Heeralal v. State of Madhya Pradesh, (1997) 2 Crimes 634 (MP) the Court observed that it is crystal clear that the Court has been empowered to summon any person as a witness at any stage of inquiry, trial or other proceeding. The power is not confined to any particular class of person.

question.question_html: Which one of the following sections of the Cr. P.C) provides as to security for good behavior from habitual offenders?

answers.text_html: Section 110
Section 109
Section 108
None of the above

question.subject: Uncategorized
question.explanation_html: Explanation: Ans. (a) Section 110. Section 110 of CrPC deals with the security for good behavior from habitual offenders

question.question_html: “Victim Compensation Scheme' has been provided under Criminal Procedure Code by which of the following amendment ?

answers.text_html: Cr. P. Code (Amendment) Act, 2008
Cr. P. Code (Amendment) Act, 2009
Cr. P. Code (Amendment) Act, 2005
None of the above

question.subject: Uncategorized
question.explanation_html: Explanation: Ans. (b) Cr. P. Code (Amendment) Act, 2009. Sec. 357A has been inserted in CrPC which deals with Victim Compensation Scheme.
